subject: Physical Fitness
title: Motor Units and Recruitment
description: A 60-second lesson on Motor Units and Recruitment.

hook.text: Pick up a feather and your arm barely tries. Pick up a suitcase and it fires on all cylinders.

buildup.text: A motor unit is one nerve and all the muscle fibers it controls. Small tasks recruit few units.

discovery.text: As force demand rises, your nervous system recruits more and larger motor units â€” smallest first.

twist.text: Untrained people can only recruit about 70% of their motor units. Training unlocks the rest.

climax.text: This is why beginners get stronger before muscles grow. The brain learns to recruit more fibers.

punchline.text: Early strength gains are brain gains, not muscle gains.

quiz.question: Why do beginners gain strength before visible muscle growth?
options: Their nervous system learns to recruit more motor units
